headline: CIO sees the tech rally as durable, not a bubble
summary: STORY: While skepticism around technology stocks persists, Tengler says that caution is healthy and she points to  Walmart as an example of how technology adoption is driving productivity and boosting margins.  "We've talked about Walmart and now they've shifted to the Nasdaq, which is kind of amazing, but they've embraced all of the technology," she said. "Not just AI but robotics and they've embraced cloud computing and they're utilizing it across every aspect of their business.""We think that continues because they were an early adopter," Tengler added. "We think you're going to continue to see old economy companies that are utilizing technology to enhance margins."

headline: Costco quietly speeds up checkout with two major changes
summary: Costco customers largely rejected self-checkout, and the warehouse club responded by removing it from most stores. That follows recent trends where both Walmart and Target have limited many self-checkouts to a maximum amount of items. In some ways, those changes were made to limit theft ...

headline: Retail ETF (RTH) Touches New 52-Week High
summary: RTH hits a new 52-week high, rising 28.2% from its low, as strong gains in top retail holdings fuel fresh momentum.

headline: Whole Foods Founder Calls Jeff Bezos a ‘Genius’ Who Killed the ‘Whole Paycheck’ Stigma
summary: John Mackey reveals how a mega-competitor's obsession with price wars accidentally created the perfect opening for Whole Foods' upscale grocery strategy.

headline: Walmart Opens New Eastvale Supercenter to Support a Growing Community with Speed, Value, and Choice
summary: EASTVALE, Calif., January 14, 2026--Today, Walmart’s newest Supercenter and first location in Eastvale, located at 14100 Limonite Ave., officially opened at 8 a.m., following a 7:30 a.m. ceremony recognizing the City of Eastvale, its leadership, and the store’s new team of associates.

headline: Supreme Court Tariff Ruling Won't Come Today (Live Coverage)
summary: The Supreme Court won't rule on the constitutionality of some of President Donald Trump's tariffs this morning.  The tariff backdrop is just one of the drivers, along with lower mortgage rates and bigger tax refunds about to start flowing thanks to One Big Beautiful Bill Act tax cuts.  The Supreme Court hasn't yet said when it will next announce opinions.

headline: Retail sales rose a better-than-expected 0.6% in November as the holiday season kicked into gear
summary: Shoppers increased their spending in November from October as holiday shopping kicked into full gear.  Retail sales rose a better-than-expected 0.6% in November, following a revised 0.1% decline October, according to the Commerce Department.  The report was delayed more than a month because of the 43-day government shutdown.

headline: Walmart Stock Hits 52-Week High: Should You Stay Invested?
summary: WMT hits a 52-week high as steady sales, strong e-commerce growth and higher-margin businesses keep investors confident.

headline: Social Security’s 2.8% COLA Won’t Cover What Retirees Actually Buy
summary: The 2.8% Social Security cost-of-living adjustment that took effect in January 2026 initially looked like good news. With overall inflation running at 2.7% in December, the COLA appeared to provide a small cushion. But for many retirees, the national inflation average doesn’t tell the whole story. The goods and services retirees depend on most—healthcare, groceries, ... Social Security’s 2.8% COLA Won’t Cover What Retirees Actually Buy

headline: 1 Mega-Cap Stock with Exciting Potential and 2 Facing Challenges
summary: "Too big to fail" is how we would describe the megacap stocks in this article today. While they will likely stand the test of time, it’s not all sunshine and rainbows as their scale can limit their ability to find new sources of growth.

headline: McCormick: A Dividend Aristocrat Priced For Perfection
